Posts.EditableText: Does this happen to anyone else where there's a built-in time limit to the game? People keep complaining that they get a message saying "session has timed out" when they play my game but I haven't seen it happen with other games. It seems like this can be avoided if you register a textadventures account and log in before you play but I'm not sure if that's accurate. Anyone know what's up?

Posts.EditableText: If you are playing on line, and make no moves for a while ( bathroom break, lunch, phone call?)  the game will time out.
Posts.HTML: If you are playing on line, and make no moves for a while ( bathroom break, lunch, phone call?) the game will time out.

Posts.EditableText: Yes, it will timeout if playing on-line and you do not do anything for a while (20 or 30 minutes?). If you are logged in, you can save before you take that bath, but it will still timeout. It is a feature of the web site, and not anything we as game creators can change, and is necessary to keep the total number of sessions on the web player manageable.
